current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide assistance to Ukraine to reduce the dependence of Ukraine on imports of natural gas from
			 the Russian Federation, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Ukrainian Independence from Russian Energy Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Ukrainian Independence from Russian Energy Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

Ukraine is dependent on natural gas supplies from the Russian Federation to meet more than half of
			 demand in Ukraine.

Entities owned by the Government of the Russian Federation have manipulated natural gas supplies
			 and prices in Ukraine in order to gain geopolitical leverage over Ukraine
			 and neighboring countries of Ukraine.

Energy subsidies provided by the Government of Ukraine amount to roughly 8 percent of the gross
			 domestic product of Ukraine and
			 make energy markets opaque, inefficient, and susceptible to corruption.
Ukraine is the second-least energy efficient country in the world.

The International Energy Agency has estimated that if the economy of Ukraine were as energy
			 efficient as the average country in Europe, Ukraine would reduce natural
			 gas consumption by greater than 50 percent.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
could nearly eliminate the
			 dependence of Ukraine on imports of natural gas from the Russian
			 Federation.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Ukrainian Independence from Russian Energy Act/s:2/p:6

text.#text: The level of savings from the reduction described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
has estimated that Ukraine could reduce the amount of natural gas used for
			 heating by 50 percent through efficiency measures.

text.#text: The

On April 25, 2014, a coalition of 35 cities in Ukraine sent a letter urgently requesting assistance
			 in increasing the energy efficiency of their buildings, district heating
			 systems, and transportation networks in order to reduce dependence on
			 imports of natural gas from the Russian Federation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to help stabilize the economy
			 of Ukraine requires reforms of energy markets in Ukraine and includes
			 provisions to gradually eliminate energy subsidies, which will raise
			 retail natural gas rates by 56 percent in 2014, 40 percent in 2015, and 20
			 percent in 2016 and 2017.

text.#text: A $17,000,000,000 loan package from the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
could have
			 devastating impacts on low-income households in Ukraine.

text.#text: Absent large reductions in energy consumption, the rate increases mandated by the

Ukraine is estimated to have significant conventional and unconventional oil and gas reserves,
			 which are mostly untapped.

The International Energy Agency has estimated that Ukraine possesses natural gas reserves of
			 approximately 5,400,000,000,000 cubic meters, although the annexation
			 of Crimea by the Russian Federation may impact Ukraine’s recoverable oil
			 and gas reserves.

Exports of liquefied natural gas from the United States to Ukraine would not provide assistance for
			 Ukraine in the short term and would be unlikely to reach Ukraine in the
			 long term because—
of natural gas global market dynamics;
there are no liquefied natural gas import facilities in Ukraine; and

the Government of Turkey has indicated it would block shipments of liquefied natural gas through
			 the Bosphorus Strait because of safety concerns.
It is the policy of the United States to use all resources of the United States Government—

header.#text: Policy on supporting energy independence of Ukraine

text.#text: to encourage private sector investment in the energy sector of Ukraine;
to protect low-income households in Ukraine from dramatic increases in energy rates;
to increase transparency and reduce corruption in the energy sector of Ukraine;

to improve
			 energy efficiency, increase domestic energy supplies, and develop
			 alternative sources of energy in Ukraine in order to reduce the reliance
			 of Ukraine on
			 energy from the Russian Federation; and

to increase the capacity of agencies of the Government of  Ukraine, nongovernmental organizations,
			 and private entities to administer and manage energy efficiency and energy
			 security-related projects  in Ukraine.

header.#text: Assistance from the united states agency for international development

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Ukrainian Independence from Russian Energy Act/s:4/ss:b

text.#text:
prioritize, to the extent feasible, the provision of
			 direct assistance to Ukraine to improve energy efficiency, increase energy
			 supplies produced in
			 Ukraine, and reduce reliance on energy imports from the Russian Federation
			 through measures described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Ukrainian Independence from Russian Energy Act/s:4/ss:b

text.#text:
through the Development Credit Authority, make
			 loan, lease, and bond guarantees to appropriate financial institutions and
			 other eligible borrowers to facilitate the involvement of such
			 institutions and other borrowers in financing and expanding efforts in
			 Ukraine to improve energy efficiency, increase energy supplies produced in
			 Ukraine, and reduce reliance on energy imports from the Russian Federation
			 through measures described in
The measures described in this subsection include—
replacing inefficient boilers;
upgrading district heating systems;
improving metering and measurement systems for natural gas use and heating;

upgrading natural gas and heat distribution systems, including pipes that leak or are poorly
			 insulated;
improving the efficiency of buildings;
reducing losses in natural gas transmission systems;
improving the efficiency of compressor stations;
improving efficiency in the industrial sector;

legal and regulatory support focused on natural gas and electricity market rules, regulations, and
			 transparency, developed in accordance with the terms of the stand-by
			 arrangement between the

support for structuring of gas and electricity markets with cost-reflective pricing, developed in
			 accordance with the terms of the stand-by arrangement;

encouraging greater natural gas and electricity interconnections between Ukraine and neighboring
			 countries;
developing renewable sources of energy; and
developing energy transmission, refining, and storage facilities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:

protect public health and safety;
protect the environment;
effectively manage royalties and revenue; and
increase transparency and reduce corruption.
